required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Motor Parameters in Patients With Limb Girdle Muscular Dystrophy
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization and Identification of Motor Parameters Using Instrumental Assessment in Patients With Limb Girdle Muscular Dystrophy

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to perform 2-year follow up with motor parameters evolution using instrumental assessments in patients with limb girdle muscular dystrophie, and to identify which motor parameters are sensitive to change.
The secondary objectives of the study are:
- to describe the changes of the parameters obtained from instrumental evaluations in comparison with the changes obtained from clinical assessments.
- to characterize the muscular impairments, the biomechanical gait disorders, the standing postural control disorders, the biomechanical upper limb disorders in spatial exploration, the limitation of upper limb capacities, the fatigue, the endurance, the patients' participation to their activities and their quality of life, in comparison with a healthy paired population.
- to highlight the relationships between muscular assessment parameters, biomechanical gait parameters, standing posture control and upper limb spatial exploration.
- to highlight the relationships between data from instrumental assessments and data from clinical assessments.
- to highlight the relationships between instrumental assessments data and clinical assessments data on one side, and features of patients (age, sex, duration since diagnosis, type of LGMD, rehabilitation in follow-up, sportive practices...) on the other side.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a monocentric study in which 2 sub-groups of people will be enrolled: LGMD patients and healthy volunteers. Each enrolled LGMD patient will have 5 visits during 2 years, one baseline visit and four half-yearly visits. Each enrolled healthy volunteer will have one planned visit only. The duration of enrollments will last 20 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on maximal strength
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Maximal strength and muscular activation of knee extensors will be evaluated by isometric test with an isokinetic dynamometer (Biodex Medical Systems Inc., Shirley, New York, USA).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on peak hip flexion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Hip flexion peak during gait will be evaluated with tridimensional gait analysis with an optoelectronic system ((Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on speed of center of pression during standing postural control
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Speed of center of pression will be measured by force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on elbow peak extension during upper limb spatial exploration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Elbow peak extension will be measured biomechanically with an optoelectronic system during upper limb spatial exploration (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on muscular parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal strength during isometric tests of hip, knee flexors, ankle and maximal grip strength. (Biodex Medical Systems Inc., Shirley, New York, USA) Muscular fatigue

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on gait speed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used. Spatio-temporal = speed (m/s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on step length
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on cadence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on step width
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on % single support phase of gait cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on % swing phase of gait cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint kinematic parameters: change from baseline on % support phase of gait cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Spatio-temporal from biomechanical gait analysis: an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on kinetic gait parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Kinetic parameters will be obtained from biomechanical gait analysis with AMTI force plateforms (Advanced Mechanical Technology, Waterton, MA, USA). This includes peak of ground reaction force in antero-posterior and vertical axis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural control parameters: COP displacements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). Parameters of stabilization include: Mean and maximal speed of center of pression (COP) displacements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural control parameters: elliptic surface
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). Parameters of stabilization include: Elliptic surface covering 90% of COP positions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural control parameters: Amplitude of COP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). Parameters of stabilization include: Amplitude of COP shift in anteroposterior and mediolateral axis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural control parameters: Romberg quotient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). Parameters of stabilization include: Romberg quotient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural orientation parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). The orientation parameters include: mean position of COP in anteroposterior and mediolateral axis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on standing postural orientation parameters: limb loading ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters of stabilization and postural orientation during postural control assessment on force platforms (AMTI, Advanced Mechanical Technology), Waterton, MA, USA). The orientation parameters include: limb loading ratio.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on drinking task with left and right upper limb: velocity and movement time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The spatio-temporal parameters will be obtained from biomechanical analysis with an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) including: Velocity and movement time (Total movement time / Peak velocity/ Mean velocity)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on drinking task with left and right upper limb: movement strategy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The spatio-temporal parameters will be obtained from biomechanical analysis with an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) including: Movement strategy (Time to peak velocity / time to first peak)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on drinking task with left and right upper limb: smoothness and coordination movement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The spatio-temporal parameters will be obtained from biomechanical analysis with an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) including: Smoothness and coordination movement (number of movements units / interjoint coordination)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on drinking task with left and right upper limb: trunk displacement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The spatio-temporal parameters will be obtained from biomechanical analysis with an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) including: Trunk displacement

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on drinking task with left and right upper limb: angular joint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The spatio-temporal parameters will be obtained from biomechanical analysis with an optoelectronic system (Optitrack system, Natural Point Inc. Corvallis, OR, USA) including: Angular joint

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on 6 minutes walking test distance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: 6 minutes walking test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on the Berg Balance Scale score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Berg Balance Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Brooke Upper Extremity Scale score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Brooke Upper Extremity Scale score for upper extremity capacities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on locomotor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires Abiloco

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on upper limb capacities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires Abilhand

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on patient occupations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Patient occupations assessed by COPM (Canadian Occupational Performance Measure). The measurement will be from 1 (not at all performant) to 10 (very performant) as score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on MRC (Medical Research Council) score on flexors and extensors of lower and upper limb
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Testing MRC (Medical Research Council), a scale for muscle power. The muscle scale grades muscle power on a scale of 0 to 5 in relation to the maximum expected for that muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS) for fatigue assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on number of fall risks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on number of physiotherapy sessions per week
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on number of sports practice per week
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Individualized Neuromuscular Quality of Life Questionnaire (INQoL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at 6 months, 12 months, 18 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life questionnaire: INQoL

arm_group.description: 40 patients with limb girdle muscular dystrophie
40 healthy volunteers without neuromuscular or squeletic disorder

study_pop.textblock:
Population with limb girdle muscular dystrophie for 2-year longitudinal follow-up in Raymond Poincaré hospital. The 4 most common types of diseases: calpainopathy, sarcoglycanopathy, dysferlinopathy and alpha-dystroglycanopathy.
Control group: healthy population without neuromuscular or squeletic disorder.

overall_official.affiliation: Laboratoire d'analyse du mouvement, Service d'explorations fonctionnelles, Hôpital Raymond Poincaré, APHP
Plateforme Nouvelles Technologies, Hôpital Raymond Poincaré, APHP

facility.name: Laboratoire d'analyse du mouvement, Service d'exploration fonctionnelles, Hôpital Raymond Poincaré, APHP
